para: When the method parameter for the &skel; modifier is set to SpecificRationalization, the specific tools listed by the rationalizers parameter will be used to reduce the number of poorly shaped &elems;. Each will be applied to the &elems; that meet the criteria determined by its arguments.

In scripts, rationalizers is a list of constructors, like this:
OOF.Skeleton.Modify( skeleton='pi:skeleton', modifier=Rationalize( targets=AllElements(), criterion=AverageEnergy(alpha=0.3), method=SpecificRationalization( rationalizers=[QuadSplit(angle=150), RemoveBadTriangle(acute_angle=15,obtuse_angle=150)] ), iterations=1))

In the GUI, after selecting Specified for the method parameter of the &skel; modifier, the widgets shown in will appear. The check marks select the particular s to be used. The parameters for each Rationalizer are listed below its name.
